title: 3M Agrees to Combine Its Food-Safety Unit With Neogen
sub_head: The deal, structured as an RMT, values the combined company at $9.3 billion including debt
body:
3M Corp. on Tuesday agreed to combine its food-safety business with Neogen Corp. , a food testing and animal healthcare specialist, to create a combined company worth $9.3 billion, including debt.
Neogen, based in Lansing, Mich., has a market value of $4.3 billion, while 3Mâ€™s is around $100 billion. The Wall Street Journal earlier reported such a deal was imminent.
